results.title: Cricket: Australian style
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Don Murray and Neil Howe
results.brief_description: A documentary on cricket as it is played in Australia in 1974. Offers highlights from a match between Australia and New Zealand and presents comments about the game by the then Australian captain Ian Chappell.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Film Australia, Don Murray and Neil Howe

results.title: Cricket story
results.brief_description: Cricket in Australia from the early days to the 1961 Australian tour team, including an interview with Sir Donald Bradman, who discusses the factors behind Australia’s success in cricket. School cricket, expert coaching, Sheffield Shield matches and selection for Test cricket. The last match of the 1961 series with the West Indies at the Melbourne Cricket Ground, and the memories and traditions associated with Test cricket.

results.title: Cricket in Australia (Captioned)
results.brief_description: From the time of the first test, through days of Aboriginal teams visiting England, the drama of the bodyline series, and the 1977 World Cricket Series Revolution, Australians have always been “cricket mad”. Jack Egan brings together cricket greats to recall highlights of their career, as well as using magnificent archival footage. Special appearances by Ian Chappell, Bill O’Reilly and Lindsay Hassett.

results.title: Cricket Coaching Clinic
results.brief_description: A program in which international cricketers demonstrate the essential skills of the game. “The Cricket Coaching Clinic” is designed to instruct and motivate young and old, the uninitiated and the experienced.
results.description: A program in which international cricketers demonstrate the essential skills of the game. “The Cricket Coaching Clinic” is designed to instruct and motivate young and old, the uninitiated and the experienced.

results.title: Cricket batting strokes. Part 3
results.brief_description: Made to show students the fundamentals of good batmanship, with demonstrations by Len Hutton and coaching by H. P. Crabtree. the film falls into three sections. Part three “Cut, Hook, and Glide”: Les Hutton demonstrates the use of the square cut, the late cut, the hook, and the leg glide strokes in match play and in practice at the nets . Schoolboys practice the various strokes with their coach.

results.title: Cricket batting strokes. Part 2
results.brief_description: Made to show students the fundamentals of good batmanship, with demonstrations by Len Hutton and coaching by H. P. Crabtree. the film falls into three sections. Part two “Backplay”: Introductory shots of a school match lead to a complete analysis of back play to an off-ball and to a leg-ball. Hutton demonstrates the strokes and Crabtree coaches a class, correcting their mistakes.

results.title: Cricket batting strokes. Part 1
results.brief_description: Made to show students the fundamentals of good batsmanship, with demonstrations by Len Hutton and coaching by H. P. Craptree. The film falls into three sections. Part one “Forward Defence and Attack”: The forward defence stroke is analysed; the stance, grip of bat and method of making the stroke are illustrated in shorts of Hutton practising at the nets. The forward attack stroke is similarly analysed.

results.title: Cricket batting strokes with Len Hutton
results.brief_description: Made to show students the fundamentals of good batsmanship, with demonstrations by Len Hutton and coaching by H. P. Craptree. The film falls into three sections. Part one “Forward Defence and Attack”: The forward defence stroke is analysed; the stance, grip of bat and method of making the stroke are illustrated in shorts of Hutton practising at the nets. The forward attack stroke is similarly analysed. Part two “Backplay”: Introductory shots of a school match lead to a complete analysis of back play to an off-ball and to a leg-ball. Hutton demonstrates the strokes and Crabtree coaches a class, correcting their mistakes. Part three “Cut, Hook, and Glide”: Les Hutton demonstrates the use of the square cut, the late cut, the hook, and the leg glide strokes in match play and in practice at the nets. Schoolboys practice the various strokes with their coach.

The forward attack stroke is similarly analysed. Part two “Backplay”: Introductory shots of a school match lead to a complete analysis of back play to an off-ball and to a leg-ball. Hutton demonstrates the strokes and Crabtree coaches a class, correcting their mistakes. Part three “Cut, Hook, and Glide”: Les Hutton demonstrates the use of the square cut, the late cut, the hook, and the leg glide strokes in match play and in practice at the nets. Schoolboys practice the various strokes with their coach.

Schoolboys practice the various strokes with their coach.

results.title: Cricket
results.creator_credit: Pathé Frères, Peter Baylis and Grahame Tharp
results.brief_description: A broadcast commentary on a Test Match at Lord’s provides a background against which cricket is seen as a game; a craft; and interest of the people; a piece of history. We see the craftsmen who make the ball, and the bat - that “forth straight stick” with which the batsmen defend “the other three”; then the craftsmen who play the game, from W. G. Grace in the nets to Sir Donald Bradman and Dennis Compton in the “Tests”. The history of the game is epitomised in shots of the Long Room at Lord’s, and from there the camera moves to the village green, to the London side-street where the urchins play on a bumping pitch, to South Africa and India, where in the blinding light “there is often an hour to play the last man in.” Narrated by John Arlott and Sir Ralph Richardson.
